data.title: It's Your Business: Collier-Lee Beasley radio station, staffers win honors
data.meta_description: The day's local news in Business in Collier and Lee counties.
data.text:
By Daily News Staff

Naples-based Beasley Broadcast recently handed out top awards for the year for radio stations it operates in 11 markets across the country, including several in Southwest Florida.

Southwest Florida stations serving Fort Myers-Naples earned the top company prize in the radio station, general manager and sales manager categories. The winners are:

--B1039 WXKB-FM is Beasley’s “Radio Station of the Year.” WXKB is a contemporary hit radio/Top 40 formatted station that is recognized for its use of social media and community service outreach in the region.

--Vice President and Market Manager Brad Beasley is General Manager of the Year. He has served as market manager of Beasley’s Southwest Florida cluster of five radio stations since 1996 and has been with Beasley Broadcast Group since 1988.

--AJ Lurie is Sales Manager of the Year. He was promoted to director of sales for Beasley’s Southwest Florida cluster of radio stations this year. He joined Beasley Broadcast SW Florida in 2007.

Founded in 1961, Beasley Broadcast owns and operates 44 stations in 11 large and midsize markets in the U.S.

Naples chamber holds three special events

The Greater Naples Chamber of Commerce recently held ribbon-cutting ceremonies for three chamber members who celebrated special events.

They are:

--Racetrac, 5101 NW 21st Ave., Suite 345, Fort Lauderdale, (786) 877-4516, www.racetrac.com. On average, each store offers more than 4,000 retail and food service items.

--Painting with a Twist, 13500 U.S. 41 North, Suite 7, Naples, (239) 221-3170, www.paintingwithatwist.com/naples. Bring a favorite adult beverage and friends; an instructor will teach you painting.

--Home Care Assistance of Naples, 3605 U.S. 41 N., Naples, (239) 449-4701,www.homecareassistancenaples.com. The business provides older adults with care that enables them to live happier, healthier lives at home.

Second Cup Mercato hosts business event

Second Cup Mercato is the site for a Local Business Meet & Greet next week.

The event from 6:30-8:30 p.m. Sept. 18 is hosted by Erik David Barber of Premier Sotheby’s International Realty’s The Gulf Luxe Team. It will feature local businesses, including Myxn Scents, EJ’s Café, The Ryan Sherman Team at Morgan Stanley and Time Trial Cycle, as well as the nonprofit United Way of Naples.

The event is open to the public with RSVPs requested by Sept. 15 at TheGulfLuxe.com.

Second Cup frequently hosts a range of businesses, groups and clubs for meetings and events. Reservations for meetings are requested and can be made through the café manager by calling (239) 653-9072.
